FuncDef:
The clock alarm-threshold frequency-offset command configures an alarm threshold for frequency offset at the physical layer.
The undo clock alarm-threshold frequency-offset command restores the default configuration. The clock alarm-threshold frequency-offset command configures an alarm threshold for frequency offset at the physical layer. The undo clock alarm-threshold frequency-offset command restores the default configuration. By default, the alarm threshold for frequency offset at the physical layer is 9200 ppb. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold for frequency offset at the physical layer.
The value is an integer ranging from 10 to 92. The default value is 92, in 100 ppb.
